column4: Hi, got a question. When I torrent (I'm torrenting a legit cd, a Gutsy iso) at school, I use Deluge and it doesn't download anything, even with a non-standard port and encryped transmission. Can anyone suggest me how to find ports that will work?
use a portscanner and find which ports are open
nmap is the best theres a gui frontend called nmapfe
from the cli type: sudo apt-get install nmapfe
yup you need to run as root
one sec and i'll find out for you
try tcp window scan and udp port scan
sorry, which tab is that under?
you need to scan the router
how do I do that? I'm in a dorm
whats your ip addy, pm it to me if you want
nmaponline didnt find anything. I dunno wtf is going on with this firewall
colleges/schools tend to have everything blocked by default
copy the port numbers he's using
